hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{40}$ pieces of candy.


And we know the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$:

There are $\purpleC{5}$ pieces of candy per bag.

The quotient will tell us the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$ is the $\blueD{\text{number of bags}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\blueD{\text{number of bags}}$.

question.content:
Annie has $40$ pieces of candy divided into bags of $5$.

**What does the expression $40\div5$ represent?**

choices.content: Number of candy pieces in each bag
